summary: Fallopian tube cancer is a malignant neoplasm that originates from the fallopian tube. It is grouped under epithelial ovarian cancers and shares similarities and treatments with ovarian and primary peritoneal cancers. It occurs when there are genetic mutations in the DNA, often of unknown cause, but can also be inherited. The cancer forms in the tissues lining a fallopian tube, which are part of the female reproductive system.
risk_factors: Inherited BRCA1 or BRCA2 gene mutations
symptoms: Pain in the abdomen or pelvis
Swelling in the abdomen or pelvis
Feeling of pressure in the abdomen or pelvis
Sudden or frequent urge to urinate
diagnosis: Imaging tests (transvaginal ultrasound, abdominal ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)
Detection of a pelvic mass on routine gynecologic examination
treatments: Surgery (total abdominal hysterectomy, removal of ovaries, tubes, uterus, cervix, omentum removal, lymph node sampling)
